  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Manager, Sales Operations",
  "description": "Hugo is a Future-of-Work company. We build and manage remote teams in black communities for some of the world&rsquo;s largest technology and media companies. We specialize in end-to-end machine learning data annotation and omnichannel support solutions that ultimately yield more inclusive outcomes for both black communities globally and our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Manager, Sales Operations

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Work mode: Hybrid
Department: Revenue &amp; Sales

What You will be Doing


	As Senior Manager, Sales Operations, you will lead the structure, organization, and execution that powers Hugo&rsquo;s mid market GTM engine. Reporting to the Head of Revenue Operations, you will oversee a small team of Sales Administrators and RevOps staff who execute critical sales motions including campaign execution, contact research, account prep, competitive intelligence gathering, sequencing builds, and outbound support.
	Your mandate is to bring clarity, order, and predictable execution to the revenue organization.
	You will build processes, strengthen systems, enforce standards, and ensure the sales team has the support they need to operate efficiently.
	You will manage incoming requests, translate them into structured workflows, and ensure your team delivers quality output on time.
	This role is ideal for someone who is deeply operational, people oriented, and thrives in a high velocity environment. You are part coach, part project manager, and part systems thinker.


Key Responsibilities
Team Leadership:


	Build, coach, and lead a small team of Sales Administrators and Sales Ops contributors.
	Establish clear expectations, workflows, and quality standards for task execution.
	Create a culture of accountability, accuracy, and speed.


Process and Project Management:


	Own and optimize the intake and prioritization process for all Sales Operations requests.
	Set up structured workflows for campaign builds, sequencing, contact acquisition, account enrichment, and competitive research.
	Ensure requests are completed with consistent quality and delivered on time.
	Develop documentation, SOPs, checklists, and templates that improve team efficiency.


Sales Technology Ownership:


	Own and administer Hugo&rsquo;s sales technology stack including HubSpot, Monday.com, and connected systems.
	Partner with internal teams to ensure clean data hygiene and accurate reporting.
	Identify opportunities to simplify workflows or automate manual steps.


Pipeline and Performance Insights:


	Conduct recurring pipeline analysis to surface trends, gaps, and areas requiring focus.
	Deliver weekly reporting to Sales Leadership with clear insights and recommended actions.
	Monitor activity performance across outbound and inbound motions.


GTM Support:


	Support campaigns and motions targeting mid market digital native and B2B organizations.
	Ensure the sales team has the research, tools, and operational support needed for effective outreach.
	Coordinate with Marketing Operations on lead flows, contact quality, and segmentation when relevant.


Cross Functional Collaboration:


	Partner with the broader Revenue team to ensure alignment across campaigns and reporting.
	Work with RevOps leadership to improve the effectiveness of systems, dashboards, and process flows.


Requirements
Competencies:


	Strong people leader with a coaching mindset; able to develop early career talent into high performers.
	Organized operator with the ability to bring structure to ambiguous environments.
	Exceptional project management skills with strong follow through and attention to detail.
	Comfortable working with data, reporting, and pipeline analysis.
	Clear communicator who can translate complex requests into structured workflows.
	Technically confident with sales tools and systems including CRM and workflow platforms.
	Thrives in fast paced environments and enjoys solving operational challenges.


Experiences:


	Experience managing a Sales Operations or Sales Administration function is a plus.
	Experience working in or supporting mid market B2B or digital native companies preferred.
	Familiarity with HubSpot, Monday.com, and modern sales tech tools.
	Experience in BPO, professional services, or tech enabled services is a plus but not required.
	Africa First talent strongly encouraged to apply.

We specialize in end-to-end machine learning data annotation and omnichannel support solutions that ultimately yield more inclusive outcomes for both black communities globally and our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Manager, Sales Operations

Job Location: Nigeria
Work mode: Hybrid
Department: Revenue & Sales

What You will be Doing
     

            
    




	As Senior Manager, Sales Operations, you will lead the structure, organization, and execution that powers Hugo’s mid market GTM engine. Reporting to the Head of Revenue Operations, you will oversee a small team of Sales Administrators and RevOps staff who execute critical sales motions including campaign execution, contact research, account prep, competitive intelligence gathering, sequencing builds, and outbound support.
	Your mandate is to bring clarity, order, and predictable execution to the revenue organization.
	You will build processes, strengthen systems, enforce standards, and ensure the sales team has the support they need to operate efficiently.
	You will manage incoming requests, translate them into structured workflows, and ensure your team delivers quality output on time.
	This role is ideal for someone who is deeply operational, people oriented, and thrives in a high velocity environment. You are part coach, part project manager, and part systems thinker.


Key Responsibilities
Team Leadership:


	Build, coach, and lead a small team of Sales Administrators and Sales Ops contributors.
	Establish clear expectations, workflows, and quality standards for task execution.
	Create a culture of accountability, accuracy, and speed.


Process and Project Management:


	Own and optimize the intake and prioritization process for all Sales Operations requests.
	Set up structured workflows for campaign builds, sequencing, contact acquisition, account enrichment, and competitive research.
	Ensure requests are completed with consistent quality and delivered on time.
	Develop documentation, SOPs, checklists, and templates that improve team efficiency.


Sales Technology Ownership:


	Own and administer Hugo’s sales technology stack including HubSpot, Monday.com, and connected systems.
	Partner with internal teams to ensure clean data hygiene and accurate reporting.
	Identify opportunities to simplify workflows or automate manual steps.


Pipeline and Performance Insights:


	Conduct recurring pipeline analysis to surface trends, gaps, and areas requiring focus.
	Deliver weekly reporting to Sales Leadership with clear insights and recommended actions.
	Monitor activity performance across outbound and inbound motions.


GTM Support:


	Support campaigns and motions targeting mid market digital native and B2B organizations.
	Ensure the sales team has the research, tools, and operational support needed for effective outreach.
	Coordinate with Marketing Operations on lead flows, contact quality, and segmentation when relevant.


Cross Functional Collaboration:


	Partner with the broader Revenue team to ensure alignment across campaigns and reporting.
	Work with RevOps leadership to improve the effectiveness of systems, dashboards, and process flows.


Requirements
Competencies:


	Strong people leader with a coaching mindset; able to develop early career talent into high performers.
	Organized operator with the ability to bring structure to ambiguous environments.
	Exceptional project management skills with strong follow through and attention to detail.
	Comfortable working with data, reporting, and pipeline analysis.
	Clear communicator who can translate complex requests into structured workflows.
	Technically confident with sales tools and systems including CRM and workflow platforms.
	Thrives in fast paced environments and enjoys solving operational challenges.


Experiences:


	Experience managing a Sales Operations or Sales Administration function is a plus.
	Experience working in or supporting mid market B2B or digital native companies preferred.
	Familiarity with HubSpot, Monday.com, and modern sales tech tools.
	Experience in BPO, professional services, or tech enabled services is a plus but not required.
	Africa First talent strongly encouraged to apply.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Contract
     

            
    



Key Roles & Responsibilities

	Manage the transportation and installation design by the T&I contractor and manage the interface between fabricators and T&I contractors.
	Set up a culture of strong leadership with a key focus on collaboration, transparent communication & empowerment of direct reports.
	Manage the T&I interfaces with the following groups: Wells, EPF1, epF2, HUC and Pipelay.
	Demonstrate visible commitment to HSSE goals, including compliance with the Life Saving Rules and Goal Zero targets.
	Undertake or manage structural integrity assessments for the topsides and jacket structures.
	Participate in the risk assessment process as well as other project reviews to identify key jacket, piles, topsides and bridges technical risks and propose solutions.
	Effectively utilize the Management of Change (MOC) process.
	Support lifting and hoisting, and marine utilities systems.
	Ensure seamless handover of platforms and bridges to the HUC contractor.
	Deliver risk-mitigation strategies and cost-saving opportunities through rigorous review of inspection/maintenance strategies and procedures.


Requirements
Academic Qualification:


	Graduate in an Engineering discipline.
	COREN registered with working knowledge of oil and gas facilities and project engineering systems, tools and practices.


Required Experience:


	Must have at least 15 years of extensive experience in the oil & gas industry.
	Must have at least 10 years of experience in offshore execution and at least 5 years in an offshore lead position
	Must have experience and a proven track record in contract management and be able to maintain a good working relationship with contractors during the execution of the contracts.


Skills & Competencies:


	Pro-active, resilient, motivated, positive, team player, energetic.
	Leadership experience in offshore gas production & processing, offshore mega-projects construction with sufficient depth and breadth to assess and assure the risks associated with the execution of simultaneous activities offshore, especially in shallow water.
	Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills with good communication skills.
	Proven track record of delivering results in a challenging project environment.
	Willing to spend time at fabrication and construction locations (potentially overseas) as well as time offshore.
	In-depth knowledge of safety management systems, emergency response, operations, marine and aviation logistics, contracts and contractor management, industrial relations, project planning, and reporting.
	Outstanding leadership skills with the ability to develop, motivate, coach, and maintain a high-performing team and effectively lead changes in an offshore work environment and culture.Qualifications in project management are highly valued.
	Proactive and visible HSSE leadership, demonstrating commitment to safety with SIMOPs activities and multiple Contractors.

	Ability to manage multiple complex problems, integrating solutions across multiple disciplines.
	Commitment to creating a respectful environment where people are heard, cared for, and equipped for success.
	Demonstrated resilience under challenging operational conditions.

Frontend Engineer Job at FCSL Asset Management Company




        
    

        
        FCSL Asset Management Company was incorporated in 1994 and has been operational for nearly 3 decades, providing various investments, financial services and advisory, with the Corporate Finance and Advisory, Equities and Fixed Income Securities and Markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Frontend Engineer

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Job type: Full-time / Hybrid

Duties and Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Design, develop, and maintain robust, scalable front-end solutions that enhance the user interface and overall user experience
	Implement responsive web design principles to ensure applications perform seamlessly across desktops, tablets, and mobile devices
	Optimize applications for speed, performance, scalability, and search engine effectiveness
	Collaborate closely with back-end engineers, product managers, and UI/UX designers to deliver intuitive and functional user experiences
	Translate product and business requirements into high-quality technical solutions and user interfaces
	Create and maintain reusable components, front-end libraries, and prototypes to support rapid development
	Support back-end teams with front-end integration, debugging, and troubleshooting as needed
	Conduct code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and brand guidelines
	Maintain high visual and graphical standards, ensuring consistency with the company’s brand and design system
	Continuously improve existing applications by fixing bugs, improving performance, and adding new features.


Requirements
Educational & Professional Qualification:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.


Experience:


	3–5 years of hands-on experience as a Front-End Developer
	Strong proficiency in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
	Solid experience working with modern frameworks and libraries such as React, Angular, Vue.js, or similar technologies


Competency Requirements:


	Strong understanding of the web development lifecycle, including design, development, testing, and deployment
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and multitasking skills

title: Job Openings at Greenfield Catering Limited
content:
Greenfield Catering Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions:

1.) Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a friendly and organized Front Desk Officer to be the first point of contact for our guests.
	The ideal candidate will ensure excellent customer service, handle reservations, and support smooth front desk operations.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Welcome and assist guests with check-in and check-out
	Manage reservations and room assignments
	Answer phone calls and respond to guest inquiries
	Handle payments and maintain accurate records
	Ensure the front desk area is clean and professional
	Coordinate with housekeeping and other departments for guest needs.


Requirements


	Previous experience in hospitality or customer service preferred
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Basic computer skills (MS Office, MS Excel reservation systems)
	Professional appearance and positive attitude
	Ability to work flexible shifts, including weekends and holidays.


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Staff meals and discounts
	Opportunities for career growth in hospitality


Application Closing Date: 10th March, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Account Clerk (Hospitality)

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are looking for a detail-oriented Account Clerk to join our hospitality team.
	The Account Clerk will assist with financial record-keeping, support daily accounting operations, and ensure accuracy in transactions.


Responsibilities


	Record daily financial transactions (sales, purchases, expenses)
	Maintain accurate ledgers and accounting records
	Assist with invoice preparation and payment processing
	Support monthly reconciliations and reporting
	Work closely with the finance team to ensure compliance with company policies.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND / Bachelor`s Degree
	Previous experience in accounting or clerical roles (hospitality experience preferred)
	Basic knowledge of accounting principles and bookkeeping
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
	Proficiency in MS Excel or accounting software
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Staff meals
	Opportunities for career growth in hospitality.


Application Closing Date: 3rd March, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Storekeeper

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for a dedicated Storekeeper to join our hospitality team. The Storekeeper will be responsible for managing inventory, ensuring proper storage of food and supplies, and supporting smooth kitchen operations.


Responsibilities


	Receive, inspect, and record deliveries of food, beverages, and supplies
	Organize and maintain storage areas to ensure cleanliness and safety
	Monitor stock levels and report shortages promptly
	Issue items to kitchen and service staff as requested
	Ensure compliance with food safety and hygiene standards
	Keep accurate records of stock movement and usage


Requirements


	Previous experience as a Storekeeper or in inventory management (hospitality preferred)
	Strong organizational and record-keeping skills
	Knowledge of food safety and storage practices
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Basic computer skills for inventory tracking.


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Staff meals and discounts
	Opportunities for career growth in hospitality.


Application Closing Date: 10th March, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
